  1. Include FooTable Base CSS

    <link href="path_to_your_css/footable.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
    ** FooTable is now built to work with Twitter Bootstrap out of the box! **

  2. Include jQuery

    <script src="http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.9.1/jquery.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>

  3. Include FooTable jQuery Plugin

    <script src="path_to_your_js/footable.js" type="text/javascript"></script>

  4. Initialize FooTable!

    <script type="text/javascript">
	$(function () {
		$('.footable').footable();
	});
</script>

Breakpoints

FooTable works off the concept of breakpoints. These can be customized, but the default breakpoints are 

breakpoints: {
	phone: 480,
	tablet: 1024
}

Column Setup

You then need to tell FooTable which columns to hide on which breakpoints, using data-hide attributes:

<table class="footable table">
	<thead>
		<tr>
			<th>Name</th>
			<th data-hide="phone">Job Title</th>
			<th data-hide="phone,tablet">Status</th>
			<th data-hide="all">Address</th>			
		</tr>
	</thead>

In the above example the following will be true:

Column Data Attribute Shown on Desktop Shown on Tablet Shown on Phone
Name [none] yes yes yes
Job Title data-hide="phone" yes yes no
Status data-hide="phone,tablet" yes no no
Address data-hide="all" no no no
